I receive the message [b]The Steam Servers are currently unavailable. Please try again later.[/b] or [b]The Steam Servers are too busy[/b] while using Steam - what should I do?

[h2]Error Code 53[/h2]This error can often be resolved by checking for [url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/1F39-DCB4-FF28-5748]Programs Which May Interfere with Steam[/url] that are preventing Steam from operating normally.

[h2]Change your Download Region[/h2]Try changing your Download Region to see if it affects the issue:

[h3]On Windows[/h3][olist]  	[*]Start Steam[/*]  	[*]Go to [b]Steam > Settings > Downloads[/b] tab[/*]  	[*]Under [b]Download region[/b], select a different but relatively close region.[/*]  	[*]Try launching or installing the game once more [/*]  [/olist]    [h3]On Mac[/h3][olist]  	[*]Start Steam[/*]  	[*]Click on [b]Steam > Preferences > Downloads[/b] tab[/*]  	[*]Under [b]Download region[/b], select a different but relatively close region.[/*]  	[*]Try launching or installing the game once more [/*]  [/olist]

[h2]Repairing corrupted Steam files[/h2]It is possible that over time your Steam files have become corrupted. Try the following to repair your Steam files.
[h3]On Windows[/h3]To fix this error use the following steps:
[list]  	[*]Exit Steam[/*]  	[*]Navigate to your Steam installation directory. ([b]C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\ [/b] by default.)[/*]  	[*]Delete everything in that directory [b]EXCEPT[/b] the following:  	[list]  		[*][b]steam.exe[/b][/*]  		[*][b]steamapps[/b] directory (All of Steam's game files are kept here.)[/*]  	[/list]  	[/*]  	[*]Restart Steam to test the issue[/*]  [/list]    [h3]On Mac[/h3]To fix this error use the following steps:
[list]  	[*]Exit Steam[/*]  	[*]Navigate to [b]Users/[username]/Library/Application Support/Steam[/b][/*]  	[*]Delete everything in that directory except for the steamapps folder (Note: you may lose mods or custom content with this method)[/*]  	[*]Launch Steam from your Dock or Applications folder[/*]  [/list]

[h2]Connection Issues[/h2][section style=note]  [h3]Note:[/h3]Steam does not support connecting through a network DMZ (de-militarized zone), so this setting must be disabled in your router for Steam to function. For more information, please follow our guide to [url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/46D2-B5B1-F0B9-B867]Using a Router with Steam[/url].[/section]
Many Steam issues can be caused by a firewall, anti-virus, or a problem with your router or internet connection.

Please use the [url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/669A-2F68-D1D1-A5EC]Troubleshooting Network Connectivity[/url] guide to ensure that your network is properly configured for use with Steam.

[h2]Disable any programs which interfere with Steam[/h2]Please consult the topic linked below and make sure any programs on the list are either disabled or uninstalled:

[url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/1F39-DCB4-FF28-5748]Programs Which Interfere with Steam[/url]

[h2]Remove Spyware, Adware, and Viruses[/h2]If the issue persists it is possible that a virus, adware, or spyware may be interfering with the installation process. Please see the topic linked below for instructions to remove the offending program:

[url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/70D4-67C8-784D-692A]Spyware, Malware, Adware, and Viruses Interfering with Steam[/url]

[h2]Steam Network Outage[/h2]If the Steam Network is experiencing a large amount of traffic or if the network is temporarily off-line, you may not be able to use Steam immediately. Please follow the link below to check the Steam Network Status page:

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/stats/]Steam Network Status[/url]

[h2]Recent purchase not recognized yet[/h2]If you experience this error while trying to install or register a game, log out of Steam and log back in to determine whether or not your purchase was successfully processed:
[olist]  	[*]Go to the upper left in the Steam client and select [b]Steam[/b] [*]Then select [b]Change Account...[/b][/*]  [/olist]After Steam restarts you will be prompted for your username and password. After logging in you should be able to download and/or install the games.
title: Steam Servers Are Currently Unavailable or Too Busy
